result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan J Mendieta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Juan J Mendieta in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:51 a.m.  Court calls case
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files an amended information.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Pay fine of $50 plus costs which includes the DNA Surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge/Victim Witness Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan

Count 2 -
Pay costs which includes the DNA Surcharge/Victim Witness Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan

Pre-trial conference at 11-02-2015 08:45 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Juan J Mendieta in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:58 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.  Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant appears from jail by video.

11:04 AM Court calls case.

ADA  Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC and Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
Court informs Defendant he has the right to remain silent.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  July 27, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
